Iron resources in known deposits total 2200 million metric tons of ore.  Twenty mineralized areas meriting further study were identified.</abstract></descript><accconst>none</accconst><useconst>none</useconst><keywords><theme><themekt>Alexandria Digital Library Feature Type Thesaurus</themekt><themekey>mineral deposit areas</themekey></theme><place><placekt>Common geographic areas</placekt><placekey>fAF = Afghanistan</placekey></place><theme><themekt>USGS Thesaurus</themekt><themekey>aluminum</themekey><themekey>barium</themekey><themekey>building stone resources</themekey><themekey>carbon</themekey><themekey>chromium</themekey><themekey>copper</themekey><themekey>economic geology</themekey><themekey>fluorine</themekey><themekey>gold</themekey><themekey>iron</themekey><themekey>lead</themekey><themekey>mercury</themekey><themekey>metallic mineral resources</themekey><themekey>natural resource assessment</themekey><themekey>potassium</themekey><themekey>rare earth elements</themekey><themekey>sulfur</themekey><themekey>tin</themekey><themekey>tungsten</themekey><themekey>zinc</themekey></theme></keywords></idinfo><metainfo><metd>20120904</metd><metc><cntinfo><cntperp><cntper>Schweitzer, Peter N</cntper><cntorg>ER Mineral Resources</cntorg></cntperp><cntaddr><addrtype>mailing address</addrtype><address>12201 Sunrise Valley Drive Mail Stop 954</address><city>Reston</city><state>VA</state><postal>20192</postal><country>USA</country></cntaddr><cntvoice>703-648-6533</cntvoice><cntemail>pschweitzer@usgs.gov</cntemail></cntinfo></metc><metstdn>Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata</metstdn><metstdv>FGDC-STD-001-1998</metstdv></metainfo></metadata>
